intro: Impatiens larsenii, commonly known as the Larsen's impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is a member of the Balsaminaceae family, known for its rapid growth and ornamental value. Due to its unique appearance and habitat preferences, it is often cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
